alert.note: Alert for Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 3:14PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Houston, north central Jackson and southwestern Early Counties through 500 PM EDT/400 PM CDT/... At 413 PM EDT/313 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Cottonwood, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood, Dothan, Marianna, Ashford, Cowarts, Webb, Kinsey, Malone, Cottondale, Greenwood, Avon, Madrid, Gordon, Campbellton, Bascom, Memphis, Saffold, Pansey, Crosby and Grangeburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
